text: Circa 1900.
A white man in a top hat introduces the final act of a bl face performance.
In the spirit of true minstrelsy, you have again shown that laughter is the wine of life.
Some 50 performers stand and break out into song.
Roll credits to the music.
An average American teenage boy begins to speak. His name JOLIE.

All my life, my parents have told me I'm smart and talented. That I can be anything I wanna be when I grow up. Getting into the West Branch Magnet Program was supposed to be some kinda honor. They probly thought I'd grow up to be a doctor, or a lawyer, or scientist that cures cancer and junk. I mean for me school has always been a breeze.
Now in the mid-90s, for our story present day.
But when I look around, I just feel surrounded by dorks.
Angle on an old school hoop on the horizon. A kid silouet against the sky lays the ball in.
(V.O.) All I want, is to be like the kids on varisty, who live in the Maple Ave towers.
A part of a suburban neighborhood lines with huge apartme buildings.
(V.O.) The maple ave kids are coming up from nothing. I mean, their only shot at college is balling. And they've got girls blowing up their pagers twenty-four seven.
Black kids play ball apartment buildings towering over th
The young naive face of Jolie in the midst of tryout.
(V.O.) I pray to God I make varsity. I'd do anything to be like the Maple Ave. kids.

Montage of tryout - Jolie the olny white kid among them. Suicide drills. Push ups. Machine gun defensive stand exercises. Scrimmaging. Jolie is just a breath behind everyone at pretty much all of them.
And now Jolie is at the line. A classic american basketba tryout drill. Miss and you run.
All the players but Jolie watch from the baseline.
Jolie lines up his shot carefully.
He glaces at the coach who holds a clipboard.
Jolie fires. For a split second it's dead on but then it bricks wildly.
The kids take off running.
That was terrible.
Sounds of a high pace video game begin.
JOLIE, in his tighty-whities, plays Sonic on a Sega Genes Also on the bed, black girl HENRIETTA AARONSON tries to d her homework.
Do you think you're gonna make varsity?
Jolie drops his controller and tears up.
School is so wack.
Jolie composes himself.
I support you no matter what. But I can't be changin' no diapers.
Henrietta looks defeated.
Jolie pauses Sonic. Curls up with her.

(voice over, whisper) I've been fucking Henrietta for a while. She's the best. She's pregnant with someone else's baby but I'm cool with that. In fact, I think that's why I like her so much. She's kinda thugged out.
Jolie rubs her stomach.
Your stomach's smooth.
Henrietta pops up.
Not now Jolie.
I think you look more beautiful like this than anything. I wish you could be this way forever. We'd be so happy like this.
A drop of sweat runs down Henrietta's face and lands on a sheet of paper full of algebra equations.
I love you.
Jolie, now clothed, bounds down the stairs with bookbag a basketball.
Hey, Mr. Aaronson.
(emerging from kitchen) Hey.
You got my check?
Shit man, those hours really add up, hun?
Mr. Aaronson grabs his checkbook off the top of the TV an heads to the kitchen.
I guess.
Jolie flips on the TV and catchs a little of the OJ Simps trial.

(V.O) Henrietta's adopted. She lives in a big house like me. Her parents pay me to tutor her in geometry. She's kind of an outcast. I think that's why we click. Plus, our moms both work for the same law firm. They fly all over the country doing somethin'.
Mr. Aaronson flips off the TV.
What a mess... So, how do you think she's doing? Is she gonna pass?
Uh, I don't know. Maybe.
Mr. Aaronson tenses up, then relaxes again and hands over check.
I don't get it. She was always a great student.
(searching for word) ...you know... Geometry's a hard thing. Algebra leads to it and if you dont get that then-
Yeah yeah I guess so. Well, you do what you can.
Yea.
Peace out.
Thanks.
The bells RINGS. Ethnic murals line some of the walls, ot are just the old school red brick.
(V.O.) My great great grandfather was a famous black face performer.
Changing classes. Kids of all shapes, sizes and colors. J emerges among them.
They used to call him the greatest performer of all time. But now. Kids at school have never even heard of him. I mean not even magnet kids in AP history have heard of him.
Jolie and his best friend HAROON are in the back. Haroon' scrawny Afghan boy with glasses.
Haroon glances at his bulky calculator watch and raises h hand.
Hey, can I be excused for the Million Man March?
Hey, can I use the bathroom?
The teacher MR. MCCARTY already has the passes raised.
Empty except Jolie and Haroon.
Dude, don't they post who made the team today?
Naw, not till Monday they said.
Alright man, have a good day at school.
Yeah right.
See ya.
They smack a secret handshake and Haroon exits.
Alone, Jolie looks longingly out the window.
Lucky bastards.
Haroon waves good-bye to Jolie.
Minority kids are hopping into cars with their march sign psyched to be getting out of school.
(voice over, whisper) This sucks. All the minorities get an excused absence for the Million Man March.
An almost white looking kid enters the frame.
(V.O.) But me, I'm stuck in school like a bama.
Haroon waves a last goodbye from his Nissan Saturn.
Jolie - still looking enviously out the window.
(V.O.) I wish I was one of them. I wish I was one of them. I wish I was one of them. Fuck.
Henrietta rocks out to her walk-man while jamming on some homework.
Jolie's in his underwear again playing Sonic.
(V.O.) I'm supposed to tutor Henrietta every Sunday. She's getting an F in math. She knows how to do it though. She's flunking on purpose.
Jolie looks back at Henrietta and smiles to himself.
(V.O.) She's so gangster.
Jolie, clothed, bounds down the steps again, this time tw a time.
Suburban homes with large apartments towers in the background. The school is in the more urban part of town.
The doors spray-painted "thug life."

location: WEST BRANCH HS TRACK AND FIELD

text: Jolie and Haroon sit on the hill doing homework.
Hey you heard Fransisco got arrested?
FRANCISCO, bare chested, struggles against a security gua He looks directly into the camera.
I'm innocent, this is bull shit!
Over some pictures on the Internet.
Jolie looks confused.
Oh you mean like netscape?
Yea.
Haroon gets up to leave.
Yo dont forget I need my computer homework back by Monday.
I got you. Dont forget to get me my bio homework back.
Yea duh.
The walk into the distance.

(voice over, whisper) My great great grandfather had a song, Hallelujah I'm a Bum. Tupac had a song, I'd Rather Be an N.I.G.G.A., so we can get drunk and smoke weed all day. I always thought they were really similar.
Haroon and Jolie in identical poses.
Yo. I gotta take a massive dump, will you guard the door while I'm in there.
Yea.
They raise their hands - again in identical positions.
Haroon in the stall taking a dump.
Jolie at the urinal - simultaneously pounding a Sunkist a taking a whiz.
I'm taking the most epic shit. Oh! Dude! Don't they post who made the team today?
Jolie looks suddenly worried. It dawns on him. He rushes
Don't forget I need my computer homework back? Jolie!?
Jolie rushes toward the camera.
(V.O.) As a white boy at West Branch I'm just not cool.
He's zeroing in on a wall full of sports posters - at it' center a golden piece of paper labled "THE TEAM."
But making the team would change my life forever.
Jolie looks down the list.
(V.O.) It's my one shot to fit in with the Maple Ave kids. To actually be somebody!
Jolie's face brightens.
Jolie walks past it and does a double take.
It's the list.
CLOSE ON JOLIE'S EYES: pure intensity.
He stands motionless, holding his breath, reading.
Then leans back, covering his dropped jaw.
(voice over, whisper) Making the team, felt like the most important thing in my life.
Jolie takes off running down the hall past a mop leaning against the wall.
(voice over, whisper) As a white boy I just didn't fit in, not in Takoma Park. But now...
Jolie becomes a black silhouette against a row of windows
(voice over, whisper) I was practically black.
Jolie, in his gold Webber jersey, hops in the woods. He w large purple ankle weights, and "Jump Soles" (clunky and clumsy looking work out shoes).
(voice over, whisper) I even ditched class to work on my hops.
Exhausted, Jolie gathers his basketball and backpack and leaves.
A metro train roars past in the background.
Jolie is bench pressing and Haroon is spotting.
A single florescent fixture hangs overhead.
Man, I can't believe you made the team.
Jolie finishes his set. Pops up.
I was the last bama on the list! If Francisco hadn't been arrested I'd still be a loser! I'd be just another Joe Shmoe Lame-oh geek in the Blair High School Magnet.
CLOSE ON HAROON: his face slowly falls.
Oh hey, can your mom give you a ride home later. There's something I gotta do.
Oh... Yeah. Yeah. That's cool.
They rotate positions - we see that Jolie has only been lifting 5 lb. weights.
2.5's right?
Yeah.
Jolie leans down on the bar and grins to himself - still cloud nine.
A shiny cherry-red '93 Nissan Quest approaches.
(voice over, whispering) Tupac. Biggie. Snoop Dog. Easy-E. Dr. Dre. Suge Knight. Mr. T.
The Quest pulls to the curb - Jolie and his Dad inside.
Alright bye. No injuries.
Jolie hops out in black and red basketball gear - black headband, black Jordans, even black socks.
Alright, bye Dad.
A clunker 90s cell phone rings. Jolie's Dad answers.
Hey, you back from the hill? What happened?
Henrietta sits alone on a stump listening to her Walkman.
Jolie bounds down a path startling her.
It smells like dog shit in these woods, Jolie. Why'd you want to meet out here anyway?
Jolie chokes up.
Wow. That is pretty bad. It smells like a dead mouse or something.
You dont want to be seen with me do you? Cus I'm pregnant.
...what? No.
Henrietta softens.
You wanna make out with me?
Yea but, I can't. Not no more. We can't be hanging out any more. You understand though right?
...Why?
Henrietta, I told you. I made the basketball team. I'm a Blazer now.
Henrietta looks crest fallen.
Jolie hacks up some spit.

Look. If I make the NBA I'm gonna take care of you and your baby. We're gonna live in a big house in Potomac. Be rich, have maids. That's the reason I'm doing this. Can't you see that? Can't you be happy for me?
Henrietta shakes her head in utter disappointment.
She drops Jolie's basketball and walks off.
Pregnant, her ass might be a little bigger than before.
Then she stops and turns.
Jolie spins his basketball on one finger.
Do you need a token for the bus or some junk?
Crushed, Henrietta leaves.
Jolie watches her descend through a romantic archway of b - a blacktop and basketball hoop in the distance.
I felt bad but,
Jolie darts up the hill - basketball in hand.
Henrietta had rich white parents. And after I made the team
CLOSE ON: his black shoes and socks.
I realized, compared to me she wasn't thugged out at all. She was just bad at Algebra.
Jolie disappears into the woods.
For a while I was worried her Dad, Mr. Aaronson, would be mad.
Jolie runs past a jungle gym with a little boy hanging fr the monkey bars.
But he was cool. He even offered me 20 bucks to mow the lawn. So, everything worked out.
Jolie jogs past a pregnant woman.
I guess.
The blazers dress after practice, everyone chatting among many aisles. But Jolie is all alone in an aisle by himsel
Jolie slams the locker door.
Jolie is deep on the bench.
The acoustics are bad. The semi full bleachers fill the s with echoes.
The crowd is various shades of black. A lot of them have their feet kicked up.
Classic red versus blue.
The action on the court is fast paced. The players are disciplined, setting screens and running concrete plays.
WENDEL, a guard, pulls up for a shot - swish.
The cheerleaders get excited.
The home score flashes red and reappears as 86 to 52. A b out.
The team of Blair Blazers sit together, their heads movin unison, following the action.
At the end of the bench are ARIUS and Jolie. ARIUS, cover in sweat, is a tall thin, care-free, light-skinned black He has a huge scar on his head, a thick red headband and aids over his earrings.
Jolie is bone dry and still in his warm up suit.
Now it comes with two free controllers and the game.
(not paying attention) Oh yeah.
Yeah. We were playing that joint at my place and one of the cheerleaders was all confessing how cute she thinks you are.
Which one?
(points to the cheerleader
Christine Ortanyez.
Jolie focuses in on a particularly cute Panamanian cheerleader - CHRISTINE ORTANYEZ.
JOLIE POV: slow motion of Christine - taps her palms and a leg kick then looks directly at us.
Jolie!

Coach Dale - in afine suit and gold rimmed glasses - glar
Get Pistol.
Jolie rips off his warm-ups in a panic. The shirt gets st over his head, then he trips over his pants.
His teammates look on with various expressions of concern laughter.
A cheerleader from the opposing team points and giggles.

Struggling, Jolie frees himself.
Coach Dale shakes his head and so does the fat black man directly behind him. Their expressions match exactly.
The old white referee blows his whistle hard - game over.
All the Blazers start high-fiving each other but Jolie.
A six foot long poster of a '91 Lamborghini Countach cove the wall. A Nerf basketball hoop hangs on the closed door
Haroon is dressed up as a woman, using a wig, socks as breasts, and a sheet as a skirt.
Come on man, we've gotta nail the Marion Barry skit tomorrow or I'm gonna get a B in English.
I don't feel like it. I told you.
Jolie throws an African hat and tap shoes off his bed and they smash against the wall.
Dude, it's was just a preseason game, come on.
Man, if I can't get in when we're up thirty in the preseason then I'm never gonna play.
Jolie pulls off his jersey and throws it down. He picks u switch blade and looks at his warped reflection.
He tried to put you in the game.
Yeah, for thirty seconds.
There's a knock on the door.
Jolie wipes a teary eye and straights up.
ELLIOTT, Jolie's oddly old dad - enters with a bright ora Nerf ball off the bedside table.
Three. Two.
One.
Elliott dunks and freezes in mid air.
He makes the sounds of a sold out crowd, animatedly, in a comforting way.
The kids smile.
Come on, Haroon. Let's get you home.
Already?
Haroon follows him down the steps.
Elliott, will you go over this skit with me. I think you'll really like it and I need to practice or I'm gonna get a B in...
There voices fade into silence.
Jolie stands alone, grabs a dumb bell and does a few curl He pushes it up his bicpt with his hand so that it looks bigger.
Jolie climbs in through the window.
The only light in the room comes from the Sega on pause.
I knew you'd be back.
Because you know I love you.
Jolie kissed her with lots of tongue.
Whatever.
What?
Jolie smiles.
You're the best. I love you forever Henrietta.
You promise.
I promise to God.
Are you gonna help take care of my baby?
I'd do anything for you.
Jolie turns off the TV, and in the near darkness of just night light quietnly mounts her.

Wait. I want you to know... There's some stuff. I feel like you're the only one I can trust, the only one I can talk too. Like about when I ran away, and let those kids take photos of me. I couldn't tell anyone but you. You know that right?
I know. They were just photos. Everyone makes mistakes.
Henrietta caresses his face and they kiss.
Jolie's stupid. He'll believe anything. But I like him. I've been failing algebra just so he can tutoring me.
The automatic sprinkler goes off.
The thing is. He's not like other guys. I mean, he's on the team, but he's not really a cool kid. I've always hated the cool kids.
Jolie steps off the porch and trips on a crack in the sidewalk.
The theater class is spread out, bored and chatty. In the distance a girl is practicing dance steps on stage.
Christine walks down the aisle and sits next to Jolie.
Hey Jolie. Have you seen this article?
Jolie is dressed in basketball attire - it's a game day. Christine is in her hot cheerleader uniform.
What? No. Lemme see.
She hands Jolie a newspaper. Their hands touch briefly, t lock eyes - a moment passes between them.
Wow. I heard Francisco got arrested but I didn't know he made the paper.
I heard he got arrested because him and a bunch of other kids banged that pregnant girl Henrietta for a dollar or something.
A REDHEAD dude with an orange hoody turns around with a spnoonful of green Jell-O, eating from his Tupperware bow
A dollar total. Or a dollar each?
Each, I hope.
That's a rumor, duh. They just took photos.
How do you know? Were you there?
I heard.
Believe what you want man. That chick got gang banged! Turned out by mad dudes like a straight porno scene.
Jolie, lost in thought. The bell rings.
Dim. No windows.
Hispanic kids line the lockers.
Pants sag and Spanish is heard.
One black kid from the team, Arius, looks in a locker mir and puts on cologne. He has a gold cross and greasy hair.
Jolie. I heard your old girl is a straight chicken-head.
Who?
You haven't heard?
Heard what?
That Maple Ave shit. You haven't seen the porn video with your girl Henrietta?
I'm not with that girl man. I just tutor her in Algebra.
Chill brother. I'm just saying...
MR. APPLEBAUM overhears this.
What are you boys buzzing about? Maple Ave this.. Maple Ave that..
You can take the niggas out the ghetto but you can't take the ghetto out the niggas.
Come on Arius. I know you've got somewhere to be.
Still stunned by the rumor, Jolie follows the steady flow kids out a single door to the:
The sun backlights the school.
Jolie emerges from the school. Christine catches up to hi
Jolie, aren't you headed to computer class?
What? Yeah.
Is everything alright? You look kind of stunned or something.
What? No. I just. The sun was in my eyes.
Oh.
What's up?
I am totally struggling with my program this month, do you think I could look at your code?
My programming skills aren't that good. But we can copy Haroon's code and just change the variable names.
Really?
Yea.
Cool. Thanks.
Christine gives Jolie a hug.
Henrietta walks past and gives Jolie an eye. Jolie preten not to notice.
From afar the kids look like ants walking in lines to and from the portables (trailer classrooms).
A school bell rings.
Henrietta approaches the Redhead Grunge Kid. They're both skipping class.
Hey, can I bum a cigarette?
Aren't you pregnant?
Whatever.
Henrietta rolls her eyes and starts to walk away.
Hold up. Here.
Thanks.
Henrietta lights up.
Fuck it, right?
Yea. I guess so.
Working in groups.
Dude, Christine's been jocking your nuts lately. What's up with that?
I don't know man. I think she's into me.
She's probably just using you for my code.
It happens to me all the time.
You wish.
Even if she does like you dude, you'd have to be loco to get with her.
Jolie looks over at Christine on the other side of the classroom. Christine smiles back.
Her last boyfriend Raymond -
Raymond, a cool Hispanic boy perched on a metal railing, cranes his head around and we see he's got a black eye an smokes a Camel.
(O.S., CONT'D) Has been having sex since junior high.
Ray hops off the railing, puts his arm around a girl and kicks over a trash can as they walk into the sunset.
That's nothing. Ray's been suspended three times. They found a gun in his locker. And he has no blood parents. You don't want that kind of sloppy seconds. It's big trouble.
Hmmm.
You would be the man, though. I'd give you that.
Yea, that's true. You would be the man.
Why? What does that have to do with anything?
All the boys roll there eyes.
IN SLOW MOTION Jolie turns to look at Christine, this tim with his hoody up. Turning back he knocks his notebook of the table - papers scattering, a can of Sour Cream Pringl spilling.
Christine notices the commotion, laughs kindly. He smiles back.
CRACK - the sound of softball being hit.
The girls team warming up.
Jolie and Christine sit on small metal bleachers.
You guys have the late practice today, huh?
Yeah.
Well Coach Dale asked me to tape the next game - you wanna see the camera we're using? It's in the small gym.
Oh yeah. All the way past C hall.
Come on. I know a short cut through parenting class.
Through parenting class? Let's just go the long way.

Come on. Don't be such a goody goody. The teacher doesn't care. Trust me. She's like a hundred years old, she gets it. It's just an excuse to have free baby sitters for all the teen moms. And that's a good thing.
She grabs his hand and leads him.
Jolie and Christine cut through the chaotic after school `class.'
Henrietta is there, looking bored, and playing with a toy toddler.
Henrietta gives Jolie a suspicious look.
Jolie waves nervously.
Are you friends with her? That's the girl I was telling you about.
I just tutor her in Algebra. You know how we need community service hours to graduate, well...
A mural of fire emblazons the walls.
A second floor balcony - overlooking the court. A space f storing of moldy old trampolines and gymnastic junk.
It's hot as a mug in here.
Christine flips on a giant standing fan.
Stand in front of this. God that feels good.
Her hair and cheerleader skirt blowing back. Jolie stands next to her.
Christine gracefully gets on her knees. Beat.
The camera's under here. Come on.
She crawls under the trampoline, through the glittery tas hanging around it's edges.
Jolie hesitates then follows but we stay behind. A pom-po and a basketball rest in the foreground.
The season hadn't even started and my life had changed forever.
Just below the tassels Christine's top lands on the floor
I swear, exactly when we kissed someone yelled score.
Kids of all shapes and sizes rush the court below with ho sticks. Haroon and Vlad and Benjamin and Anya, and the Redhead Grunge Kid and Ray among them.
Score! Score! Score!
Shut your hole!
It felt like a million bucks.
Haroon pumps his fist yes as someone gets a shot past the goalie in warm ups.
Christine fixes her hair and walks out with a VHS camcord
I felt guilty cuz of Henrietta, but as Tu Pac says, "Only God can judge me."
Jolie stands behind, in the doorway, fixing his belt and getting a touch of wind from the fan.
I did wonder if Henrietta's Dad, Mr. Aaronson, even knew she was pregnant.
Jolie takes a last glimpse of the intermural floor hockey game below them.
But for some reason it just never came up.
Jolie ducks into the stairwell.
Then all the lights go out.
Blackness.
Hold.

Would someone please stop messing around and put the lights on. This league is for serious players only.

Boom! Step aside, nigga.
Haroon slouched against the wall - blood dripping from hi temple.
(cringing in pain, almost
Oww, man. I think you broke my wrist.
Tell your boy Jolie to lay off my girl Christine. Every time he makes a move on her I'm gonna eat your ass for lunch.
(beginging to cry) What? Why me?
Haroon, and Haroon's older brother ZEKE are rummaging the kitchen cabinets for snacks. Haroon's arm is in a cast fo the rest of the movie.
Hey, are there anymore Handi-Snacks or did you take the last one?
The doorbell rings.
Jolie and Haroon smack their secret handshake.
They cross the lawn with Zeke.
Dude, before I show you this internet stuff at my Mom's place we gotta talk about this Raymond situation. Ray said he's gonna eat my ass for lunch every time you mess with Christine.
Haroon grabs a key from under the doormat of the second h
Yea he's just afraid to step to me directly because he knows varsity has my back. Don't stress though. He's just a bully.
Haroon open the door to:
Thick curtains are drawn, most of the place empty but a s computer station is in the corner.
Don't stress? He broke my arm man. How is anything under control?

Jolie fakes like he gonna punch Haroon and Haroon flinche
He'll back off.
What? Are you serious? He blind sided me. How am I supposed to hold my ground?
Come on dude, isn't that why you always carry that Batman figure around?
What?
Because Batman's the only superhero that is just a regular guy.
Batman is a cartoon. This TOY is for inspiration. We're talking about real life. Are you loco?
Fine, then just stay close to me and the team will get your back, I swear.
Pinky swear. No leaving me behind at lunch now that you're all tight with the team or nothing.
Done.
Haroon has fires up a video game on the PC.
Cool. Now let's conquor titen again. I think we can break the high score.
Seriously.

Jolie and the other kids stunned.

Naw man. It's because of that video. The Maple Ave thing...the one with Jolie's girl Henrietta.

The Administrator returns with PRINCIPAL GANUS, a 350 pou black man who looks like an ex-football player.
Arius. This is your fifth detention this semester. That means in-school suspension for the week. Starting now.
